feed.title: LF-Air
feed.subtitle: RSS feed based on RSS and LLM.

entry.title: Vite report on Sat, 07 Oct 2023 08:03:45
entry.summary:
Tech:
- Mortgage Rates: Average Mortgage Interest Rates by State, Credit Score, Year, and Loan Type
- Show HN: A job application tracker with company reviews, recruiter autoresponder
- Sam Bankman-Fried’s cofounder describes FTX’s hidden cheat code to misuse customer funds
- Why did the Motorola 68000 processor family fall out of use in PCs?
- Fail2Ban – Daemon to ban hosts that cause multiple authentication errors
- A NY startup aims to build hundreds of chip factories with prefab parts and AI
- A 20MP Sensor in a Film Canister Reinvigorates Vintage Analog Cameras
- Genetics firm 23andMe says user data stolen in credential stuffing attack
- The best price ever on Sharge’s transparent batteries and retro Mac chargers
- Electric seaglider startup Regent takes flight with $60M in new funding
- QCon San Francisco 2023: Streamlining Cloud Development with Deno by Ryan Dahl
- Deploy a Full Stack Next.js App to a DigitalOcean VPS With Docker!

Insights:
- The mortgage rates vary by state, credit score, year, and loan type.
- A job application tracker with company reviews and recruiter autoresponder is introduced.
- Sam Bankman-Fried's cofounder reveals a hidden cheat code in FTX to misuse customer funds.
- The decline of the Motorola 68000 processor family in PCs is explored.
- Fail2Ban is a daemon used to ban hosts causing multiple authentication errors.
- A startup plans to build chip factories using prefab parts and AI.
- A 20MP sensor in a film canister brings new life to vintage analog cameras.
- Genetics firm 23andMe experiences a data breach through a credential stuffing attack.
- Sharge offers transparent batteries and retro Mac chargers at a discounted price.
- Electric seaglider startup Regent secures $60M in funding.
- QCon San Francisco 2023 features a talk on streamlining cloud development with Deno.
- A guide is provided on deploying a full stack Next.js app to a DigitalOcean VPS using Docker.

Business:
- Kevin McCarthy strolled out of his former office just to insist to reporters that he's not resigning and will seek re-election in 2024: 'Not that I wanted to talk to you'
- Rep. Lauren Boebert is signaling that the fight over the speakership could get bogged down over Ukraine
- FTX co-founder Gary Wang agreed to cooperate in Sam Bankman-Fried case in his first meeting with prosecutors: 'I thought I was likely to be charged'
- Kaiser Permanente workers are set to extend their strike after talks hit a stalemate
- GM Agrees To Put EV Battery Plants Under National Union Contract, UAW Says
- Baseball’s Mets Investigation Will Seek to Answer What Steve Cohen Knew
- Microsoft’s $68.7 Billion Activision Blizzard Acquisition Nears Completion Amid Regulatory Twists
- US stocks jump, reversing up after bond yields come off highs
- Republicans are asking their Twitter followers to help them decide who should replace Kevin McCarthy
- Here's why it's so dangerous for Wall Street to bet against the American consumer
- The US Navy turned the tables on Iran, sending drones that look like speedboats to spy on its warships and troublesome gunboats
- CMO Insider's new advisory council includes marketing leaders from Mastercard, Sesame Workshop, Indeed and more
- Are banks open today? Here's a list of US bank holidays for 2023
- If Rep. Jim Jordan wins the race for House speaker, it could be the death knell for US aid to Ukraine

Insights:
- Kevin McCarthy asserts that he is not resigning and plans to seek re-election in 2024.
- Rep. Lauren Boebert suggests that the speakership fight may become entangled with Ukraine.
- FTX co-founder Gary Wang agrees to cooperate in the Sam Bankman-Fried case.
- Kaiser Permanente workers plan to extend their strike due to a stalemate in talks.
- GM agrees to put EV battery plants under a national union contract.
- An investigation into the Mets aims to uncover what Steve Cohen knew.
- Microsoft's acquisition of Activision Blizzard is nearing completion amid regulatory challenges.
- US stocks experience a jump after bond yields decrease.
- Republicans seek input from Twitter followers on who should replace Kevin McCarthy.
- Betting against the American consumer is deemed risky for Wall Street.
- The US Navy deploys drones resembling speedboats to spy on Iran's warships and gunboats.
- CMO Insider forms an advisory council with marketing leaders from various companies.
- A list of US bank holidays for 2023 is provided.
- The potential election of Rep. Jim Jordan as House speaker could impact US aid to Ukraine.

AI:
- The BBC is blocking OpenAI data scraping but is open to AI-powered journalism

Insights:
- The BBC blocks OpenAI data scraping but remains open to AI-powered journalism.

Summary of Insights:
- Mortgage rates vary based on factors such as state, credit score, year, and loan type.
- A job application tracker with company reviews and recruiter autoresponder is introduced.
- FTX's hidden cheat code to misuse customer funds is revealed by a cofounder.
- The decline of the Motorola 68000 processor family in PCs is explored.
- Fail2Ban is a daemon used to ban hosts causing multiple authentication errors.
- A startup plans to build chip factories using prefab parts and AI.
- A 20MP sensor in a film canister brings new life to vintage analog cameras.
- Genetics firm 23andMe experiences a data breach through a credential stuffing attack.
- Sharge offers transparent batteries and retro Mac chargers at a discounted price.
- Electric seaglider startup Regent secures $60M in funding.
- QCon San Francisco 2023 features a talk on streamlining cloud development with Deno.
- A guide is provided on deploying a full stack Next.js app to a DigitalOcean VPS using Docker.
- Kevin McCarthy asserts his intention to seek re-election in 2024.
- Rep. Lauren Boebert suggests the speakership fight may involve Ukraine.
- FTX co-founder Gary Wang agrees to cooperate in the Sam Bankman-Fried case.
- Kaiser Permanente workers plan to extend their strike due to a stalemate in talks.
- GM agrees to put EV battery plants under a national union contract.
- An investigation into the Mets aims to uncover what Steve Cohen knew.
- Microsoft's acquisition of Activision Blizzard faces regulatory challenges.
- US stocks experience a jump after bond yields decrease.
- Republicans seek input from Twitter followers on who should replace Kevin McCarthy.
- Betting against the American consumer is deemed risky for Wall Street.
- The US Navy deploys drones resembling speedboats to spy on Iran's warships and gunboats.
- CMO Insider forms an advisory council with marketing leaders from various companies.
- A list of US bank holidays for 2023 is provided.
- The potential election of Rep. Jim Jordan as House speaker could impact US aid to Ukraine.
- The BBC blocks OpenAI data scraping but remains open to AI-powered journalism.
